title: DSAN 6300: Mini-Project
text: Welcome to the Exploratory Data Analysis of flights in the U.S. from June 2019! As you scroll down, youâ€™ll see the data has already been processed into csvs and is simply being visualized. Prior to the data visualization, the below data was queried using MySql and exported from MySql Workbench.

title: DSAN 6300: Mini-Project
text:
Part 1: Data and Package Loading

library(dplyr)
## 
## Attaching package: 'dplyr'
## The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
## 
##     filter, lag
## The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
## 
##     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
library(ggplot2)
rank_days <- read.csv('data/rank_days.csv')
max_early <- read.csv('data/max_early.csv')
max_delay <- read.csv('data/max_delay.csv')
max_avg_delay <- read.csv('data/max_avg_delay.csv')
flight_report <- read.csv('data/flight_report.csv')
cancelled_reason <- read.csv('data/cancelled_reason.csv')
cancelled_flights <- read.csv('data/cancelled_flights.csv')
airport_max_delay <- read.csv('data/airport_max_delay.csv')

title: DSAN 6300: Mini-Project
text:
Part 2: Time Series

flight_report$FlightDate <- as.Date(flight_report$FlightDate)
flight_report |> ggplot(aes(x=FlightDate, y=three_day_avg)) + 
geom_point(size = 3) + 
labs(xlab = "Date", y = "Average Number of Flights (Past Three Days)", title = "Average Number of Flights over the Past Three Days in June, 2019") + 
theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5))
